meanings.definition: To exceed or surpass a goal or expectation.
meanings.sent1: She was overfulfilling her sales target by selling more than expected.
meanings.sent2: The team overfulfilled their project goals, impressing their manager.
meanings.sent3: The student overfulfilled the teacher's request for a one-page essay by submitting a ten-page thesis.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his craft was overfulfilling, reaching heights no one thought possible.
meanings.sent5: The garden was overfulfilling with blooming flowers, creating a colorful paradise.

meanings.definition: Achieving more than what is required or expected.
meanings.sent1: The overfulfilling student always completed extra credit assignments.
meanings.sent2: Her overfulfilling performance in the play earned her a standing ovation.
meanings.sent3: The overfulfilling cake was so large that it barely fit in the oven.
meanings.sent4: The overfulfilling joy on their faces was contagious, spreading happiness to everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The overfulfilling generosity of the community helped those in need during the holidays.

meanings.definition: To fulfill or complete a task to a greater extent than necessary.
meanings.sent1: He was overfulfilling his duties by working overtime to finish the project early.
meanings.sent2: The chef was overfulfilling the recipe by adding extra spices for flavor.
meanings.sent3: The student was overfulfilling the assignment by including illustrations and diagrams.
meanings.sent4: The artist was overfulfilling the mural, adding intricate details that amazed onlookers.
meanings.sent5: The team was overfulfilling the cleanup task, leaving the area spotless and gleaming.
